Build 20011025

Type hierarchy is on the stack and I suspect a null selection was fired. 
should SelectionProviderMediator.fireSelection guard against firing a null 
selection.

checked the SelectionProviderMediator code. The selection can not be null. Only 
empty or taken from a viewer.
From the code location I would say that action is null, but this is also very 
unlikly.
Maybe getSelectionProvider returned null (this is specified)
Suggest adding a null check there.

checked the SelectionProviderMediator code. The selection can not be null. Only 
empty or taken from a viewer.
From the code location I would say that action is null, but this is also very 
unlikly.
Maybe getSelectionProvider returned null (this is specified)
Suggest adding a null check there.

Cannot duplicate (tried several VMs, and setting up type hierarchy in debug 
perspective).  Line# referenced in walkback should still be accurate, as no 
released changes since bug reported should have changed it.  Referenced line 
is "action.setEnabled(getEnableStateForSelection(selection));" which implies 
that the action argument was null.  Suggest that guard be added to prevent 
calling selectionChanged() with a null IAction.  Moving back to JDT for comment.

Reduced severity to normal as this cannot be reproduced. Will not be considered 
critical for Dec 07 stable build.

I was guessing that 

'IStructuredSelection selection= (IStructuredSelection)view.getSite
().getSelectionProvider().getSelection()'

might have thrown the NPE. Note that getSelectionProvider() is spec'd to 
return 'null'.

Martin, I understand what you're saying.  However, line 117 *is* the 
action.SetEnabled() line, and checking the release history, I can't see any 
changes that would have caused the line number to change since the bug was 
reported, assuming that the bug was generated on the current build at the time.
I understand. I would add a guard and suggest to close to PR.
Added check for a null action.  Fixed.
